channel.title: Servers are too busy
channel.description:
Every time when i try to download any game and play existing (portal) on my mac, steam shows "Servers are too busy to process your request" and i cant do anything.
Is there a way to fix this?
This Steam thing is getting on my nerves. At first i thought it is a nice idea, but every two weeks there are at least two day when i can't play anything - because Steam does not works. And when it came to Mac, everything was perfect for a day. And since then, nothing that is connected to playing game works.

On my mac, I cant do anything.

item.title: Servers are too busy

item.description:
Well what do you fucking expect when you release a new version of a popular game which every little faggot on the earth wants to download…

Read full topic

item.title: Servers are too busy
item.dc:creator: The_Minotaur
item.description:
Restart your computer?

If you have a Dynamic IP try restarting your router or whatever to renew your IP.

If both those don’t work reinstall Steam. Remember to actually delete the steam folder.

If none of the above work then I don’t know what else to do, sorry.

Read full topic

item.title: Servers are too busy
item.dc:creator: theriddlen
item.description:
Yeah, i shall burn in hell for cheating on my trusty ol’ PC.

Read full topic

item.title: Servers are too busy
item.dc:creator: theriddlen
item.description:
I have expensive and powerful PC, which is in use almost all the day, but sometimes i don’t want to turn on this monster. Sometimes i just want to play something casually.

And first part of my complain about Steam was about working not entirely flawless on PC.

Read full topic

item.title: Servers are too busy
item.dc:creator: Firepowzer
item.description:
Well, I don’t see why anyone’d game on a mac. Also, mac’s only had steam for a few weeks now, there’s bound to be alot of bugs.
But yeah, as Brokenfridgehinge said, you should probably get a PC if you’re gonna do some heavy gaming.

Read full topic
